# About Clarity Pediatrics

Clarity Pediatrics is a digital health company founded on November 1, 2021, and is based in San Francisco, California [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/clarity-pediatrics). The company specializes in providing telehealth services for pediatric chronic care, with a primary focus on Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) for children and teens aged 5 to 17. Clarity Pediatrics operates in California and Texas, offering virtual care without waitlists and accepting insurance, which makes their services more accessible to families [(Clarity Pediatrics Summary)](https://www.claritypediatrics.com/).

The company generates revenue through its telehealth platform, which facilitates consultations with independent medical practitioners. Clarity Pediatrics is not a medical group or healthcare provider itself but acts as a facilitator for these services [(Clarity Pediatrics, Privacy Policy, April 2024)](https://www.claritypediatrics.com/privacy-policy). The company serves a significant market, as over 11% of American children are diagnosed with ADHD, and it is in-network with all major commercial insurers in California [(Clarity Pediatrics, Privacy Policy, April 2024)](https://www.claritypediatrics.com/privacy-policy).

Clarity Pediatrics offers a range of services, including ADHD screenings, Behavioral Parent Training (BPT), RUBI Parent Training, Homework Organization Made Easy (HOME), Managing Big Emotions (MBE), and ADHD Medication Management [(Clarity Pediatrics Summary)](https://www.claritypediatrics.com/). The company plans to expand its services to address other chronic conditions such as asthma, allergies, and obesity in the future [(FinSMEs, April 2024)](https://www.finsmes.com/2024/04/clarity-pediatrics-raises-10m-in-funding.html).

# Key Personnel

- **Christina LaMontagne**: CEO and co-founder of Clarity Pediatrics. She has a strong background in healthcare startups, having led two companies to over $100 million in annual recurring revenue (ARR) and profitability. Her experience in startups and telehealth positions Clarity Pediatrics for potential growth and innovation in pediatric care [(Clarity Pediatrics Programs Overview, October 2024)](https://www.claritypediatrics.com/programs-overview).

- **Alesandro Larrazabal**: Chief Medical Officer, who is triple-board certified and has extensive experience in building specialty care services [(Clarity Pediatrics Programs Overview, October 2024)](https://www.claritypediatrics.com/programs-overview).

# News

## Funding and Expansion

- On April 22, 2024, Clarity Pediatrics raised $10 million in a funding round led by Rethink Impact, with participation from Homebrew, Maverick Ventures, and January Ventures. The funds are intended to launch new clinical service lines, further develop their care platform, and expand their geographic reach [(FinSMEs, April 2024)](https://www.finsmes.com/2024/04/clarity-pediatrics-raises-10m-in-funding.html).

- Clarity Pediatrics announced the expansion of its virtual pediatric ADHD platform and the $10 million funding on April 21, 2024 [(Business Wire, 2024-04-21)](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20240419239540/en/Clarity-Pediatrics-Announces-Expansion-of-Virtual-Pediatric-ADHD-Platform-and-10M-in-Funding).

## Geographic Expansion

- On January 23, 2025, Clarity Pediatrics expanded its footprint in the U.S. by bringing its industry-leading, AAP-recommended ADHD care to Texas [(Business Wire, 2025-01-23)](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20250122284751/en/Clarity-Pediatrics-Expands-US-Footprint-Bringing-Industry-Leading-AAP-Recommended-ADHD-Care-to-Texas).

# Conclusion

Clarity Pediatrics is a promising player in the digital health space, particularly in pediatric ADHD care. With recent funding, a strong leadership team, and a clear focus on expanding its service offerings, the company is well-positioned for growth. The emphasis on a tech-enabled model and partnerships with major insurers suggest a commitment to quality care, appealing to families looking for convenient healthcare solutions. As the company continues to grow and adapt its services, it aims to transform pediatric chronic care and improve the lives of children with ADHD.

Behavioral Therapy Programs

Behavioral Parent Training (BPT)

Behavioral Parent Training is an evidence-based behavioral intervention recommended by the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) to help manage ADHD and disruptive behaviors. Clarity Pediatrics' BPT program provides caregivers with strategies to structure the home environment to guide children with ADHD toward the behaviors parents want to see (for example, by providing clear expectations and positive consequences for completing daily responsibilities and homework). BPT is appropriate for families with children ages 5 - 12 years old.

Clarity Pediatrics’ BPT group is a virtual, 1 hour/week, 8-week program with access to online resources. Sessions are for parents/caregivers only (children do not attend).

Parents and caregivers are taught skills including:

Strengthening parent/child relationships

Setting children up for success through prompts and routines

Increasing positive child behaviors through effective positive and negative consequences‍

‍

Behavioral Parent Training for Teens (BPT-Teens)

Behavioral Parent Training is an evidence-based behavioral intervention recommended by the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) to help manage ADHD and disruptive behaviors. Clarity Pediatrics' BPT-Teens program provides caregivers with strategies to improve family communication about emotions, conflict, and behavior, and how to support teens with activities of daily living (for example, homework). BPT-Teens is appropriate for families with children ages 13 - 15 years old.

Clarity Pediatrics’ BPT-Teens group is a virtual, 1 hour/week, 8-week program with access to online resources. Sessions are for parents/caregivers only (children do not attend).

Parents and caregivers are taught skills including:

Increasing positive attention and improving problem-solving as a family

Shaping teen behavior

Managing screen time, sleep and homework organization

‍

RUBI Parent Training (RPT)

RUBI Parent Training is an evidence-based behavioral intervention for families of children with ADHD and Autism Spectrum Disorder Level 1. Clarity Pediatrics' RPT program provides parents and caregivers with strategies to improve child behavior and promote new skills. These strategies have been shown to improve adaptive functioning (daily living skills) and decrease challenging behaviors, such as tantrums and noncompliance.

Clarity Pediatrics’ RPT group is a virtual, 1 hour/week, 11-week program with access to online resources. Sessions are for parents/caregivers only (children do not attend).

Parents and caregivers are taught skills including:

Why problem behaviors occur

How to encourage positive replacement behaviors

How to use praise, routines, and rewards

Parenting consistency

Homework Organization Made Easy (HOME)

Based on the evidence-based manual (Organizational Skills Training), this program's objective is to teach children skills that help with organizational challenges specifically related to homework. HOME is open to families of children in second through sixth grade who have successfully completed BPT or RPT and have daily homework.

The HOME program is a virtual, 1 hour/week, 8-week program with access to online resources. Both parents and children attend HOME sessions.

HOME targets deficits in homework organization related to:

Managing homework time

Tracking and prioritizing assignments

Clarity Pediatrics Medical Group offers individual, scheduled counseling sessions by means of tele-behavioral and telehealth (collectively, “telehealth technologies”). Our clinicians may include skilled and experienced Psychologists, Physicians, Licensed Professional Counselors, Licensed Clinical Social Workers, Marriage and Family Therapists, and equivalent licensed professionals. Generally speaking, medical and behavioral health visits conducted via telehealth technologies offer benefits such as improved access to care by enabling patients to remain in their local site (e.g., home or work) while their clinician consults and/or obtains test results at distant/other sites, efficient mental health or other appropriate medical evaluation and management, and the expertise of specialists that patients otherwise might not have.There are potential risks associated with telehealth technologies which include, but may not be limited to: the clinician may determine that the transmitted information is of inadequate quality, thus necessitating a face-to-face meeting with the patient; delays in medical evaluation and treatment could occur due to deficiencies or failures of the equipment; security protocols could fail, causing a breach of privacy of personal medical information; lack of access to complete medical records, which could result in adverse drug interactions or allergic reactions or other judgment errors in rare cases; and, it may become clear that telehealth visits, are not an appropriate treatment format given a patient’s presenting symptoms or level of functioning, resulting in a recommendation that the patient obtain additional in-person care with their primary care doctor.

Behavioral Parent Training (BPT)

Behavioral Parent Training is an evidence-based behavioral intervention recommended by the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) to help manage ADHD and disruptive behaviors. Clarity Pediatrics' BPT program provides caregivers with strategies to structure the home environment to guide children with ADHD toward the behaviors parents want to see (for example, by providing clear expectations and positive consequences for completing daily responsibilities and homework). BPT is appropriate for families with children ages 5 - 12 years old.

Clarity Pediatrics’ BPT group is a virtual, 1 hour/week, 8-week program with access to online resources. Sessions are for parents/caregivers only (children do not attend).

Parents and caregivers are taught skills including:

Strengthening parent/child relationships

Setting children up for success through prompts and routines

Increasing positive child behaviors through effective positive and negative consequences‍

Behavioral Parent Training is an evidence-based behavioral intervention recommended by the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) to help manage ADHD and disruptive behaviors. Clarity Pediatrics' BPT-Teens program provides caregivers with strategies to improve family communication about emotions, conflict, and behavior, and how to support teens with activities of daily living (for example, homework). BPT-Teens is appropriate for families with children ages 13 - 15 years old.

Clarity Pediatrics’ BPT-Teens group is a virtual, 1 hour/week, 8-week program with access to online resources. Sessions are for parents/caregivers only (children do not attend).

Increasing positive attention and improving problem-solving as a family

Shaping teen behavior

Managing screen time, sleep and homework organization

RUBI Parent Training is an evidence-based behavioral intervention for families of children with ADHD and Autism Spectrum Disorder Level 1. Clarity Pediatrics' RPT program provides parents and caregivers with strategies to improve child behavior and promote new skills. These strategies have been shown to improve adaptive functioning (daily living skills) and decrease challenging behaviors, such as tantrums and noncompliance.

Clarity Pediatrics’ RPT group is a virtual, 1 hour/week, 11-week program with access to online resources. Sessions are for parents/caregivers only (children do not attend).

Parents and caregivers are taught skills including:

Why problem behaviors occur

How to encourage positive replacement behaviors

How to use praise, routines, and rewards

Parenting consistency

The recipient’s role and responsibilities.

The specific needs of their healthcare organization.

Past interactions with your brand.

A well-crafted, personalized message increases the likelihood of engagement and conversion.

Sending regular educational emails.

Retargeting ads for interested prospects.

Following up with personalized messages at appropriate intervals.

By consistently providing value, you stay top-of-mind when the prospect is ready to make a decision.

Industry associations and trade groups.

Healthcare influencers and consultants.

Existing clients who can introduce you to other decision-makers.
